item.title: Mermaid JS support
item.description: If you want to use Mermaid-JS on your website. Provide mermaid as Shortcode in your markdown file. flowchart LR A -- B B -- A C -- D D -- B sequenceDiagram participant Alice participant Bob Alice-Bob: Hi Bob Bob-Alice: Hi Alice Find more example on Mermaid-JS website.

item.title: HTML and CSS only tabs
item.description: Basic shortcodes Link to heading The following content: {{< tabgroup >}} {{< tab name="Hello" >}} Hello World! {{< /tab >}} {{< tab name="Goodbye" >}} Goodbye Everybody! {{< /tab >}} {{< /tabgroup >}} Will generate: .tabs input#tab-0-0:checked ~ .tab-content-0-0 { display: block; } Hello Hello World! .tabs input#tab-0-1:checked ~ .tab-content-0-1 { display: block; } Goodbye Goodbye Everybody! Right alighment Link to heading You can also align the tabs to the right:

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Placeholder Text
item.description: Lorem est tota propiore conpellat pectoribus de pectora summo.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.

item.title: About
item.description: Written in Go, Hugo is an open source static site generator available under the Apache Licence 2.0. Hugo supports TOML, YAML and JSON data file types, Markdown and HTML content files and uses shortcodes to add rich content. Other notable features are taxonomies, multilingual mode, image processing, custom output formats, HTML/CSS/JS minification and support for Sass SCSS workflows. Hugo makes use of a variety of open source projects including: https://github.

FRANCISCO CASTILLO YÃ‰BANA Link to heading Summary > Link to heading ICT Professional with over 25 years of experience developed in different areas of responsibility within the field of Information Systems. My professional career has focused on the scope of infrastructure management in Data Center domain, from the side of the end customer I have worked leading management teams of international data center services primarily into companies with business units in European countries; and from the side of services and IT consulting supporting customers in the design, deployment and evolution of their Information Systems.
